title: SASUKE PREMIERES IN JAPAN
text:
Launching in 1997, Sasuke premiered on Japanâ€™s Tokyo Broadcasting System.

The three-hour sports phenomenon featured 100 competitors racing through a complex, four-stage obstacle course. Warriors had to complete each stage within the given time limit or go home empty-handed.

title: FIRST SASUKE TOTAL VICTORY
text: In 1999, a crab fisherman named Akiyama Kazuhiko was the first warrior to complete the fourth and final stage - with 6 seconds to spare.

title: KUNOICHI PREMIERES
text:
Amidst the growing popularity of Sasuke, a tournament exclusively for women was introduced as Kunoichi in 2001.

This new show paved the way for female contestants like American Ninja Warrior's Kacy Catanzaro.

title: SECOND SASUKE TOTAL VICTORY
text: It took seven years after Akiyama Kazuhiko for the second competitor, Nagano Makoto, to complete the final stage of the Sasuke course.

title: AMERICAN NINJA CHALLENGE PREMIERES
text:
In 2007, G4 created American Ninja Challenge, a nationwide competition in which American contestants competed for the title of American Ninja.

Finalists that were able to complete the final stage won a trip to compete in the Sasuke tournament in Japan.

title: AMERICAN NINJA WARRIOR PREMIERES
text: The successor to American Ninja Challenge, American Ninja Warrior would once again serve as a qualifying round for American competitors to compete in the Sasuke tournament in Japan.

title: MOUNT MIDORIYAMA RECREATED IN THE US
text: For Season 4 of American Ninja Warrior, rather than sending winners to Japan, a replica of Mount Midoriyama was erected in Las Vegas where 100 finalists from city qualifiers battled it out for the title of American Ninja Warrior.

title: FIRST WOMAN COMPLETES ANW COURSE
text: Kacy Catanzaro became the first woman to attempt and complete the American Ninja Warrior course in a national qualifying round.

title: USA vs JAPAN
text: For the first time ever, all-star warriors from the USA faced off against Japanese all-stars in Las Vegas.

title: USA vs THE WORLD
text: This second international match-up pitted the USA all-star warriors against the returning Japanese and European all-stars in a throw down to see who was the greatest warrior of them all.

title: FIRST AMERICAN NINJA WARRIOR NAMED
text:
In Season 7, two warriors reached the final stage for the first time ever in the history of American Ninja Warrior.

Isaac Caldiero, a busboy from Colorado, achieved total victory by beating out Geoff Britten in a 75-foot vertical rope climb.

title: TEAM NINJA WARRIOR PREMIERES
text:
Esquire Network presents an astounding new twist on Ninja Warrior. For the first time ever, viewers will get to see their favorite warriors form teams and compete head-to-head and side-by-side on a newly designed Ninja Warrior course.

Teams will be made up of everyone from American Ninja Warrior legends to first-time competitors. Team Ninja Warrior premiered January 19. Watch Tuesdays at 8|7c only on Esquire Network.
